6.text: When someone dies at home or in a nursing home the first contact should be with the deceased's doctor.

11.text:
If satisfied with the cause of death, the
doctor will issue the Medical Certificate

15.text:
of Cause of Death. You will need this when
you come to registering the death.

19.text: If someone dies in a nursing home, their staff should make contact with the doctor on your behalf.

26.text:
In either case, after the doctor has been
informed, you should contact your local funeral home.

32.text:
Your local Funeral Director will arrange a
suitable time, day or night, to visit you

36.text:
to discuss your requirements and bringing
the deceased into their care.

41.text: When someone dies in hospital the hospital staff will contact you and arrange for a doctor

45.text:
to issue the Medical Certificate of Cause
of Death.

49.text: If you have already decided whether the funeral will be a burial or cremation then the doctor

53.text: should be informed to ensure they can make arrangements for any additional documentation to be completed.

59.text: When someone dies unexpectedly or where the doctor is unable to issue the Medical Certificate of Cause of Death

63.text: it is normal for the Coroner or Procurator Fiscal in Scotland to be involved.

70.text: Whatever the circumstances, contact your local funeral home as soon as possible.

75.text: Your Funeral Director will be able to explain the Coroner's procedures to you.

77.text:
They will also be able to arrange a suitable
time, day or night, to visit you to discuss
